instruction: What is the name of the undergraduate program offered in economics at EWU?
response: The program is called Bachelor of Social Science (BSS) in Economics.

instruction: How many total credits are required to complete the BSS in Economics program?
response: To graduate from the BSS in Economics program, a student must complete a minimum of 123 credits.

instruction: How many credits of core courses are required in the Economics program?
response: The program requires 54 credits of core courses in Economics.

instruction: What are the general education requirements for the BSS in Economics?
response: Students must complete 24 credits of compulsory general education courses as part of the program.

instruction: How many credits of optional general education and sociology courses are required?
response: Students are required to complete 9 credits of optional general education and sociology courses.

instruction: Are there any open elective courses in the Economics program?
response: Yes, students must complete 36 credits of open elective courses, which can be chosen according to their interests.

instruction: Can you summarize the credit distribution for the BSS in Economics program?
response: The total 123 credits are distributed as follows: 24 credits for compulsory general education, 9 credits for optional general education and sociology, 54 credits for core courses, and 36 credits for open elective courses.

instruction: Is sociology part of the Economics curriculum at EWU?
response: Yes, 9 credits of optional general education courses include sociology-related courses as part of the BSS in Economics program.

instruction: Are students allowed to choose elective courses in the Economics program?
response: Yes, students must complete 36 credits of open elective courses, allowing them to explore subjects outside their core Economics courses.

instruction: What is the difference between core courses and open electives in this program?
response: Core courses (54 credits) focus on essential Economics subjects, while open electives (36 credits) allow students to choose courses from other disciplines according to their interests.

instruction: How much of the program is devoted to general education?
response: A total of 33 credits are devoted to general education: 24 credits of compulsory general education and 9 credits of optional general education and sociology.

instruction: Can students graduate without completing the core courses?
response: No, students must complete all 54 credits of core courses to graduate from the BSS in Economics program.

instruction: Are the open elective courses mandatory for graduation?
response: Yes, all 36 credits of open elective courses are required to meet the minimum graduation credit requirement of 123 credits.

instruction: How flexible is the program in choosing electives?
response: The program provides flexibility through 36 credits of open electives, allowing students to explore courses outside the core Economics curriculum.

instruction: What is the total credit requirement for general education including optional courses?
response: The total credit requirement for general education, including optional courses, is 33 credits (24 compulsory + 9 optional).

instruction: Is BSS in Economics a full-time undergraduate program?
response: Yes, BSS in Economics is a full-time undergraduate program that requires completion of 123 credits across core, general education, and elective courses.

instruction: Do students have to take any sociology courses in this program?
response: Yes, the optional general education and sociology component includes 9 credits, which may include sociology-related courses.

instruction: Can students graduate if they skip open electives?
response: No, students must complete all 36 credits of open elective courses to fulfill the 123-credit graduation requirement.

instruction: What kind of courses are considered core in the Economics program?
response: Core courses (54 credits) consist of essential Economics courses that provide foundational knowledge in economic theory, quantitative methods, and applied economics.

instruction: Are there any non-Economics courses required in this program?
response: Yes, students must complete 24 credits of compulsory general education and 36 credits of open electives, which can include courses outside Economics.

instruction: How many credits of electives can a student choose freely?
response: Students can freely choose 36 credits of open elective courses as part of the program.

instruction: Does the program have any interdisciplinary components?
response: Yes, the 36 credits of open electives and 9 credits of optional general education allow students to take courses across other disciplines, making the program somewhat interdisciplinary.

instruction: What is the open elective policy for Economics students at EWU?
response: Students must complete 36 credits from the pool of Open Elective courses. At least 15 credits must be from Economics courses, and the remaining 18 credits can be from any other disciplines. Additionally, at least 6 credits must be from 2xx level courses (including BUS 231), 12 credits from 3xx level, and 18 credits from 4xx level. Any 3-credit courses from these levels that fulfill prerequisites and are not listed can also be taken as Open Electives.

instruction: Can I take electives from disciplines other than Economics?
response: Yes, out of the 36 open elective credits, at least 18 credits can be from any discipline outside Economics, allowing students to explore other areas of interest.

instruction: Are there level-specific requirements for open electives?
response: Yes, students must complete at least 6 credits from 2xx level courses (including BUS 231), 12 credits from 3xx level courses, and 18 credits from 4xx level courses as part of the open elective requirements.

instruction: Can I take an unlisted course as an open elective?
response: Yes, any 3-credit course that meets the prerequisites and is not already listed can be advised as an Open Elective.

instruction: Who is eligible for a second major in Economics at EWU?
response: A second major in Economics is open to all undergraduate students at EWU who are not already enrolled in the BSS in Economics program.

instruction: How does earning a second major in Economics affect my degree?
response: Once a student earns a second major in Economics, their degree will include the suffix 'Economics'. For example, a student with BBA in Marketing who completes the second major will have a degree titled BBA (Marketing and Economics).

instruction: How many total credits are required for a second major in Economics?
response: A total of 45 credits are required to complete a second major in Economics, including 39 compulsory credits and 6 elective credits.

instruction: What are the compulsory courses for a second major in Economics?
response: The compulsory courses for the second major include ECO101 (Principles of Microeconomics), ECO102 (Principles of Macroeconomics), ECO260 (Environmental & Natural Resource Economics), ECO315 (Public Finance), MAT110 (Mathematics for Business & Economics I), ECO104 (Statistics for Business and Economics I), ECO301 (Intermediate Microeconomic Theory I), ECO302 (Intermediate Macroeconomic Theory I), ECO465 (Basic Econometrics), ECO467 (Intermediate Microeconomic Theory II), ECO477 (Intermediate Macroeconomic Theory II), MAT211 (Mathematics for Business & Economics II), and ECO204 (Statistics for Business & Economics II), each worth 3 credits.

instruction: How many elective credits are needed for a second major in Economics?
response: Students must complete 6 elective credits, which consist of any two ECO courses at the 300 or 400 level.

instruction: Can I choose any Economics course as an elective for my second major?
response: Yes, students can choose any two Economics courses at the 3xx or 4xx level as electives for the second major, provided they meet the prerequisites.

instruction: Is BUS 231 considered part of the open elective requirement?
response: Yes, BUS 231 is included in the 2xx level open elective requirement, which mandates at least 6 credits from this level.

instruction: Can I mix open electives from different levels to fulfill the requirement?
response: No, the open elective policy requires specific credits from each level: 6 credits from 2xx level, 12 credits from 3xx level, and 18 credits from 4xx level. Mixing across levels does not count toward these minimums.

instruction: Do I need prerequisites for open elective courses?
response: Yes, any unlisted courses taken as open electives must fulfill the necessary prerequisites to be approved.

instruction: How many credits of Economics courses must be included in the open electives?
response: At least 15 credits of the total 36 open elective credits must come from Economics courses.

instruction: Are second major courses included in my main program credits?
response: No, second major courses are separate and require 45 additional credits, independent of your primary degree program.
